intro: Geonoma stricta subsp. bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate bamboo palm, is a member of the Arecaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is a small, clumping palm that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, feather-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-white flowers, which are followed by dark blue, fleshy berries. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated as a decorative plant in subtropical and tropical regions.
